Each of us will have to put aside every other consideration beyond the facts, & focus solely on preserving the integrity of our democracy and upholding our solemn obligation to defend the Constitution. 

And history will record where we all stand.

If & when the House elects to accuse the president of an impeachable offense or offenses, the Senate will host the trial, and Senators will serve as jurors.

If and when that time comes, I know I will approach the matter seriously‚Äî& I deeply hope each of my colleagues will, too.

I‚Äôve sat as a juror in an impeachment trial before. 

It was a deeply serious undertaking‚Äîand one each Member took seriously before rendering a decision. 

That is the same seriousness required in this moment.

I believe that this country is a country of laws. 

I believe our elections must be completely free from foreign interference. 

And I believe that every elected official should ensure these fundamental principles come before party or partisanship as this process moves forward.

It would be a dereliction of duty for Congress not to investigate the grave threats to our country‚Äôs safety & our democratic institutions. 

If President Trump & his administration have nothing to hide they should stop obstructing & let Congress do its job to find all the facts.

For me and for so many other people across the country, this isn‚Äôt about partisan politics‚Äîor any politics. 

This is about maintaining our nation‚Äôs security and defending the rule of law. 

This is about nothing less than the future of our democracy.

There are still many questions about the President & his associates‚Äô actions‚Äîand the American people deserve answers. 

That‚Äôs why the House was right to begin impeachment proceedings.

The President has repeatedly sought foreign interference in our elections, which we should all find appalling. 

These facts are indisputable and can‚Äôt be spun. President Trump & his sidekicks have been clear about their actions & intentions‚Äîand it is clear they are unacceptable.

Let‚Äôs start with what we know for sure: President Trump & his associates pushed the Ukrainian gov‚Äôt to launch an investigation, without basis, into the President‚Äôs political opponents to help his election. 

Then, he made overtures to China‚Äîout in the open‚Äîto do the same.

Our nation is at a crossroads that strikes at the heart of our democracy.

The outrageous actions of President Trump & his administration have brought us to this moment, & we should step back to discuss how much is truly at stake for our country if we don‚Äôt get this right.
HAPPENING NOW: I‚Äôm on my way to the Senate floor to speak on the House‚Äôs impeachment inquiry and the grave threat President Trump‚Äôs actions pose to our safety and democracy.
